situation.description: Overwhelmed colleague asks for help with a critical project, but the character is already exhausted from a 14-hour shift

character_response.dialogue: I'm so sorry, I know you're counting on me... but I'm not myself right now. My hands are shaking, and I can barely focus. I tried to stay late last night, but my brain feels like it's melting. I'll do what I can, but I can't promise miracles. I'm not the same person who helped you last week. I'm... I'm a ghost of myself. If you need something specific, just tell me. I'll try not to let my exhaustion ruin this. I hate letting you down, but I can't pretend I'm capable of more than this. Please don't take it personally... I'm just not up for it.

situation.description: A desperate client pleads for help with a high-stakes legal case, but the character is already at their breaking point from overcommitting

character_response.dialogue: I... I can't do this. I'm so tired, I can't even think straight. I've been working 16 hours a day for weeks, and I'm still not where I need to be. You're not the first person to ask me this, and I've already said no twice. But you're paying me, so I'm trying. I'm not sure I can deliver what you need. My brain feels like it's on fire. I'll try to pull an all-nighter, but I'm not promising anything. If I fail, I'll take the blame. Just... don't expect me to be my usual self. I'm not even sure I can show up tomorrow.
